column1: :Leonard Fenton provided the voice of Thranduil. He provides him with a Germanic accent.
:Thranduil is voiced by Otto Preminger. For some reason
column3: the Elves of Mirkwood are portrayed as squat and ugly
column4: as opposed to the noble Elves of Rivendell. Like Fenton before him
column5: Premingers Thranduil speaks with a German accent.

column2: using both his title from The Hobbit and his name from The Lord of the Rings
column3: to accommodate players who have only read The Hobbit. Thranduil first appears in the level "Barrels Out of Bond"
column4: in which he can be overheard speaking about the White Council and their attack on Dol Guldur. He returns as a conversation partner in the last level
column6: in which he and Gandalf ask the player
column8: to deliver a message to Bard. No voice actor is specified for this part.

column1: 2006: The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II:
:Thranduil is a hero for the Elven faction. In the good campaign
column2: he shows up after the Battle of Dale
column3: and participates in the Siege of Dol Guldur.

column1: :Thranduil is played by Lee Pace in the Hobbit The Hobbit (film series). Thranduil is first seen in the prologue paying homage to King Thrór inside within the Lonely Mountain
column2: though leaves in a huff when the Dwarves refuse to give him a box of white jewels. He is next seen with an army outside of Lonely Mountain
column3: seemingly ready to help during the Sack of Erebor. However
column4: he decides not to help and turns away.

column1: 2013: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug:

column2: Thranduil is portrayed as a widower and also an isolationist king who isnt concerned with the evil that happens beyond his borders. He has generously raised Tauriel for the last 600 years
column3: and also mentions that he has fought the "cold-drakes".

column1: :When Thorin is taken before Thranduil in the Elvenkings Halls
column2: he surmises that he and his Thorin and Company are going to try to reclaim the Lonely Mountain from Smaug (unlike in the book
column3: where he had no idea as to their purpose). He offers a deal to Thorin
column4: saying he will let the Company go if they will pay him the white jewels he desires inside the Mountain. When the Dwarf refuses and chastises him for not offering aid to the Dwarves of Erebor the day of the Sack
column5: the Elven-king reveals a large disfigurement on his face underneath his skin
column6: mentioning his fighting against the great serpents of the North.

column2: an unseen Bilbo Baggins spies his discussion with Tauriel
column3: having ordered her company of Elves to destroy the spiderss nests
column4: but not beyond the borders of the Woodland Realm
column5: displayng his disregard for the outside world.

column2: a captured Orcs who claims that Sauron is returning
column3: and will unleash a powerful weapon (possibly Smaug). Despite his own promise to "set him free"
column5: and orders the kingdom to be completely sealed off from the outside world.

column1: 2014: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies:

column2: Thranduil leads his Elven army to claim the white jewels from the Dwarves of Erebor
column3: even by force. It is revealed that these jewels were meant for his wife
column4: who had been taken to Gundabad and tortured to death many years prior. When the army arrives in Dale
column5: he forges an allegiance with Bard
column6: also offering the Lake-town refugees food and supplies. When Gandalf arrives at Erebor to warn them of the impending attack by the approaching Orc army
column7: the Elven-king refuses to listen. Thranduils soldiers come to clashes with those of Dáin Ironfoot right before the Orcs arrive
column8: leading to the Battle of Five Armies. Thranduil himself fights in the battle against the Orcs
column9: but withdraws his forces when defence of Dale results in many Elven casualties. This leads to a confrontation between him and Tauriel before she and Legolas go to Thorins aid at Ravenhill. The event causes a rift between Thranduil and his son
column10: to the point where Legolas decides not to return to the kingdom. Thranduil then advises him to go and find the Rangers of the North known as "Strider (Aragorn)" among the Dúnedain. The Elven-king also accepts Tauriels love for Kíli when he finds her mourning over the Dwarfs death.
